name: Cheesy Stuffed Shells
author: Kimber
summary: This is a delicious baked pasta dish with large shells filled with meat, spinach and cheese that children always seem to love. It is kind of a 'spaghetti that behaves itself!'
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach - thawed, drained and squeezed dry
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add shells and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain and rinse in cold water
Place sausage in a large, deep skillet
Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown
In a large bowl, combine cooked sausage, spinach, ricotta cheese, egg, garlic, lemon juice and Parmesan cheese
Season with salt, pepper and oregano
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Stuff pasta shells with the sausage and cheese mixture and place in a 9x13 inch baking dish
Top with spaghetti sauce and mozzarella cheese
Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the pasta is heated through and the cheese is melted
